intro: Stenogyne adscendens, commonly known as the climbing stenogyne, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its twining growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and streamside areas. Its flowers are usually purple or pink and are pollinated by insects, particularly bees. Stenogyne adscendens is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
